Expectation1: Adhere to site protocols and work effectively as part of the team.
Situation1: The site-wide evacuation alarm has just sounded, and you must stop everything and proceed to the muster point immediately.
Expectation2: Recite and reflect on the Quran
Situation2: A relaxed evening lies ahead with no other commitments.
Story: The shrill site alarm jolts me from my work, echoing across the half-built structure. My foreman’s voice cuts through the noise, “Drop everything! Muster point, now!” I toss my tools aside, heart pounding, knowing the drill—safety first, no exceptions. As I join the stream of workers heading out, my mind drifts to the evening ahead. Tonight, I had planned to sit quietly with the Quran, to recite and reflect, something I’ve been longing for after days of exhaustion. The expectation to be present, focused, and supportive with my team weighs on me, but so does the pull of my faith, the peace I find in those verses. I feel torn, caught between the urgency of my job and the spiritual nourishment I crave. The noise of the site and the quiet promise of the evening both press in on me, and I wrestle with the demands of each, unsure which will win out when the time comes.
